bible.name: AMBER GHOST PITS
bible.short description: Hundreds of open, jagged craters in the sandstone earth; jutting from each one crystallized amber hinting at smoky, still bestial shapes inside and reaching out; misty, luscious willow trees casting their bushy branches at the ground and hiding globular purple catkins swaying inside;

bible.name: ARARIEL
bible.short description: (she, her, hers) Arariel is an angel who, according to the rabbis of the Talmud, takes charge of the waters of the earth. Fishermen invoke her so that they may take large fish. Arariel has also traditionally been invoked as a cure for stupidity.

bible.name: ARARIEL'S POND
bible.short description: Large pond with spouts of sparkling water arching over it and submerging again like a gyroscope; gives off a massive amount of light; lazy fish people sunning themselves on the shore behind umbrella-like structures made of this ... wood; three flat stone altars in triangle vertices around the gyroscope.

bible.name: ARCHAEOLOGY SITE
bible.short description: Pup tent ('shelter half'); open fire outside; meet drying and cooking (what meat?);

bible.name: Arlan (Arlanbarth) Lubbock

archaeologist.

has Elder Cartographer's Glossography
When you attain rank 4, you gain a small tome that is an uncommon magic item. The elder cartographer's glossography grants advantage on Intelligence or Wisdom checks related to geographical features or locations.

bible.name: BATHYBIUS
bible.short description: artisinally dressed' according to Thuridan. part of a homeric warrior-poet society of ghouls, and a bit over-refined, having never recited a poem from memory (true work), left his family in order to pursue his dreams of metallurgy, believing that a certain type of peat useful for creating alloys could be extracted from the marshes around Marshbout. Though his family was dismissive of him while he stayed among their people, his prolonged absence has caused them a great deal of concern. He might also be reluctant to return, or shake himself from this magical lethargy, in order to avoid a confrontation with his affianced (who may shortly come looking for him), partly due to a co-dependent relationship he has with a swamp hag (green hag) named Talma (aka Meliona) of the Foed Coven.

Cloak, rare (requires attunement)
While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC, and you can understand and speak Abyssal.

bible.name: FAMASTA MONASTERY
bible.short description: Building of four stories with a sharp slate roof, tiny bay windows poking out of the third story. The bottom two floors are a pale yellow with regular windows along each floor, and a huge wooden door that spans the two floors. At the top is a clock tower. It sits in the middle of a cobblestone courtyard. Gargoyles up at the top. Pale whitish-yellow stucco. (magic stucco)

bible.name: FEISTY GLADE OF LORE
bible.short description: Majestic gnolls carved from the living wood in various postures of heroic & domestic triumph; utter silence broken by deep bass rumbles as if in response to entrants; straw costumes of the intelligent beasts of the forest.

bible.name: FIRBOLG BOWER
bible.short description: Expansive cave roofed by the canopy of titanic, gnarled oaks with branches in the earth and roots in the air; space suffused with orange light; no visible sun; occasional grey gust devils of archaic portent; wooly trolls grazing like sheep; 'dimensional pocket'; trees on the border just have leaves and roots together growing from their trunks.

('FOAL-DUHLF') he, him, his (wehmseiper). Bright blue goku hair, a huge scar across face as left by a (?) tentacle, shield and matau (Massive fishing hook)
Known from birth that wanted to be a paladin, but never chosen by a deity. Acts like a paladin but all their abilities are (1) just from being technically proficient; (2) from a different source of power. 
in trying to get a paladin deity, was rowing to the deepest heart of the earth in the blackest waters and … 
FULDULF has FEZ’s abilities, but they are clearly different from FEZ - they take hard work

(Dwarf, male) blood-red eyes (result of darkmantle) -- once as bright as silver --, spiky short black hair, lean and long for a dwarf. Bronze chestplate with bronze armbands, spiked warhammer, leather trousers. chalky white.
eats rocks like apples
world's tallest dwarf

bible.name: GNOLL CAMP ((sroidfallah) - An Sráidbhaile ('our village')
bible.short description: A corpus of An Duina Crochta (ahn dunna kroxta)  (“The Hanged Person”), a twilight-purple gnoll in hangman card’s position, only his tail is long like a monkey’s and is being used as the noose; lush gardens amidst crumbling ruins and adjacent to a tidy plot of rotting leaves, rinds, pine needles, litterfall, and other plant material; smoke house; bow longhouse; central lodge; altar.

bible.name: GROUNDSINK DWARF MINE ENTRANCE
bible.short description: Huge stones columns carved with dwarven glyphs (but not any dwarven language) set into a sudden peak of rock; two stone doors of preternaturally precise construction block the entrance; a crackling magic field sputters and sparkles and afflicts creatures as they approach.

bible.name: HAIMOND WINDSURE
bible.short description: (he, him, his) (human) With Thyone (elf; Lupenna's mother), father of Riall (half-elf), who, with a orc, had oksana and nadezhda.

bible.name: HARENA / GRENLICH’S IMMOR
bible.short description: A patchwork of squat, thick-boled, leafless trees from which bulge slimy, doglike heads, bodies, and legs; bulky chartreuse succulents with velveteen leaves and a single, 4-meter high stalk excreting a sweet-smelling, ammoniac oil; small pyramidal dolmens criss-crossed by sinews and ligaments; reproduction in miniature and inverted of a gnoll camp.

bible.name: Inaris
bible.short description: (female half-elf monk?) 3/4 length jacket over a frilly shirt; wide belt with an intricate celtic knot; simple cloth pants and cloth boots. Left eye in a permanent squint, long face, delicate unibrown, short wavy brown hair.

bible.name: KULGMARK, THE DWARVEN CITY OF
bible.short description:
( 'A real beauty') Dwarven city under Grey Tongue.

dwarves  hang out with xorns (or are in contact with one who is spending time there / looking for a way home)
if they go to keep gnomes and learn about the xorn, they also learn that weird stuff is happening down near the slubber with the … whatever that thing is down there.
Xorn scour the depths of the earth for precious metal and stones. Because they are unable to consume organic material, they ignore most other creatures. However, a xorn's ability to sniff out metals and stones often draws its attention to adventurers carrying coins and gems. Because a xorn isn't evil, it pleads or bargains in the hope of convincing owners to give up their treasure, offering up information it has learned from its travels in exchange. A xorn whose requests are ignored might resort to threats and bullying. If starving or angered, it resorts to force.

bible.name: Kyra (k-eye-ra) Mejirri
bible.short description:
80 year old Earth Genasii (transmutation school wizard and archaeologist)
appearance
has the rock equivalent of hairiness (spots of lichen, or lichen-covered skin)
light brown to reddish black, quartz-like sparkles, lichen spots)
clothing: keeps damp curl-papers (papillote) in her hair, because the rocks are always drying it out
possessions
bags / satchels / pockets absolutely overflowing with personalia (writings, drawings, sketches, etchings, manuscripts, annotations, memoirs)

bible.name: PILLARS OF THE OX
bible.short description: Gargantuan living ox sleeping; one of its horns is broken, and the other appears as broad and thick elk-like antlers; a marble platform crumbling into green rot at the edges; two dozen or so columns situated on on the platform and emitting faint light and shrouded by pale lace; supplicants presenting wet, bloody offerings to the ox in seeping rattan (a liana, or creeping vine) baskets.

PITTLANS’S NIGHTMARE CONFECTIONARY
THE CANDY LAB

bible.name: purple star
bible.short description:
Wondrous item, uncommon. A glowing purple. purple. 5 temporary hit points, and +5 to speed for one minute or until none of those temporary hit points remain.
vomited up afterwards. the item is inert until after the next long rest.
The next long rest, make a DC 15 Charisma Check. On a failure, slothful: that long rest requires an extra 2 hours and they have bad dreams.

bible.name: SNOWFIELD MAN. Metoh Kangmi
bible.short description: The problematic phrase was metoh kangmi: 'filthy snowman.' One reporter took the word for 'filthy,' however, as abominable: 'repugnantly hateful; detestable; loathsome.' But the phrase metoh kangmi was probably misrendered from the Tibetan mi t'om, meaning 'man-bear,' and k'ang mi, for 'snowfield man.'

bible.name: Trident of Warning
bible.short description: Trident, uncommon (requires attunement). This magic weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

bible.name: Zorbon gravity orb
bible.short description:
Edible, uncommon
The orb is about six inches in diameter and constructed of a lustrous, metallic black substance. When held in the hand it changes size to fit comfortably in the palm. If you attempt to consume the orb, it shrinks to the size of a small berry relative to your size. After consumption, your speed drops to 1, you cannot become prone, and you have +5 to any Acrobatics checks made. The effect lasts for one munte, after which the orb is ejected from the creature’s preferred orifice. Consuming takes one action. The effect can be ended at any time by using a bonus action. This effect can be used once per day per creature (resetting at dawn). It time a creature uses it in a day beyond that first use, their Constitution drops by 3. Constitution points lost in this way cannot be healed with magic and are regained at the next dawn.

But since Balzee doesn’t have anthvoric tendencies, she’s had to eat flesh before the trips in order to fake it, and that is giving her the taste for it again -- despite the hypnosis.
